attributes.title:
Multi-unit spiking activity recorded from rat frontal cortex (brain regions mPFC,
                OFC, ACC, and M2) during wake-sleep episode wherein at least 7 minutes of wake are
                followed by 20 minutes of sleep.
attributes.description:
Data was recorded using silicon probe electrodes in the frontal cortices of male Long
                Evans rats between 4-7 months of age.  The design was to have no specific behavior, task
                or stimulus, rather the animal was left alone in it’s home cage (which it lives in at
                all times).  Data includes both local field potentials (LFP) and spikes.  11 total
                animals, 27 recording sessions, 1360 total units recorded, 1121 units considered stable,
                995 putative excitatory units and 126 putative inhibitory units.  Only recordings
                including a “WAKE-SLEEP” episode wherein at least 7 minutes of wake are followed by 20
                minutes of sleep.  On average 2 such WAKE-SLEEP episodes per recording session.
